author: ealexjordan
body:
- [X] Resolves issue #1582 
- [X] Code is [rebased](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/git/README.md#sync-your-local-repo) on `origin/master`.
- [X] Add tests that fail without your changes.
- [X] Update all relevant [documentation](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/tree/master/docs).

Just added the help page from the Windows side temporarily.

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body:
Please use the present tense (instead of present participle), imperative style for commit messages and title per [Contribution Guide](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/7a8589a8c516c3048b4555415b9ac13a24b6d6ed/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request-submission).  
**Updated PR title to match guidance.**

comments.author: vors
comments.body:
I just tried it on OS X with alpha.8 and got only this

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/816680/17655766/cbe20e5c-62ba-11e6-8bf6-298ee4bf6ebb.png)

Which doesn't match with the source. Any ideas why?

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: Yup, that's working properly. It's been converted to a man page.

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: Hm... I see the problem. It's getting truncated at conversion, partially through the synopsis. Just checked with @ealexjordan, the style tag needs to be adjusted for conversion, and the change got lost. It'll be fixed tomorrow.

comments.author: rkeithhill
comments.body: Does the team feel strongly about putting in the phrase `C# REPL`?  Because it's not C#.  What if it said something to the tune of `C# like REPL` or `.NET REPL`?

title: Adding Man Page For PowerShell
